title: The current provider doesn't have a store type mapping for properties of type 'DateIndex'.
body:
I am running a custom SQL:
```CSharp
await dbContext.Database.ExecuteSqlAsync(
    $"""
    UPDATE RadioProgramBroadcasts AS ub
    SET
        PrecedingBroadcastId = Ids.PrecedingBroadcastId,
        FollowingBroadcastId = Ids.FollowingBroadcastId
    FROM
    (
        SELECT
        b.Id,
        lag(b.Id) OVER channelAndDate AS PrecedingBroadcastId,
        lead(b.Id) OVER channelAndDate AS FollowingBroadcastId
        FROM RadioProgramBroadcasts AS b
        JOIN RadioPrograms p
        ON b.ProgramInfoId = p.Id
        WHERE b."Date" = {broadcastDate}
        WINDOW channelAndDate AS (PARTITION BY p.ChannelId, b."Date" ORDER BY b.StartTimeSecondsPrecision)
    ) AS Ids
    WHERE ub.Id = Ids.Id;
    """, cancellationToken);
```
And I get the following exception:
```
System.InvalidOperationException: The current provider doesn't have a store type mapping for properties of type 'DateIndex'.
```

Here is how `DateIndex` type is defined:
```CSharp
public readonly record struct DateIndex : IComparable<DateIndex>, ISpanParsable<DateIndex>
{
    public readonly int Value;

    public DateIndex(int value)
    {
        Value = value;
    }
    ....
}
``` 

And its conversion is defined in `OnCOnfigureConventions` method:
```CSharp
configurationBuilder.Properties<DateIndex>(b =>
{
    b.HaveConversion<DateIndexToIntConverter>();
});
```

My expectation is that EF should  use the same value converter.
Here's what docs say:
> [FromSql](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.entityframeworkcore.relationalqueryableextensions.fromsql) can be used with any scalar type supported by your database provider. If you'd like to use a type not supported by your database provider, you can use [pre-convention configuration](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/ef/core/modeling/bulk-configuration#pre-convention-configuration) to define a value conversion for it.

If this is by design and is not the case for `ExecuteSql` method, then it should be explicitly mentioned in xmldoc.  

Here's is [a repo](https://github.com/voroninp/ValueConverterIsNotUsedInExecuteSql)

EF Core version:
Database provider: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite)
Target framework:  .NET 7.0
Operating system: Windows 11
IDE: Visual Studio 2022 17.8
